analyzed: g-yul ngor spyad pa'i yo byad thams cad dang / skyed mos tshal gyi yo byad thams cad do; ;len na zhes bya ba ni rang gis so //
translated: “Takes” means by herself.

original: len du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: len du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: “Has someone else take” means by someone else.

original: kun dga' ra bar gtogs pa na 'dug pa ni skyed mos tshal na 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: kun dga' ra bar gtogs pa na 'dug pa ni skyed mos tshal na 'dug pa'o //
translated: “In a place that is part of a monastery” means in a park.

original: gnas khang du gtogs pa na 'dug pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas khang du gtogs pa na 'dug pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Except in a place that is part of a dwelling”

original: gtsug lag khang gi nang na'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi nang na'o //
translated: means in a temple.

original: des 'di snyam du 'di su'i yin pa de nyid len par 'gyur grang zhes de nyid rkyen du byas nas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des 'di snyam du 'di su'i yin pa de nyid len par 'gyur grang zhes de nyid rkyen du byas nas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If she thinks, “Whoever it belongs to will take it back,” she should take it on the condition that it belongs to that person.

original: de nyid rjes su mthun par byas pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rjes su mthun par byas pa'i chos yin no //
translated: This is the rule that accords with what is fitting.

original: dus ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni gzhag ste'o //
analyzed: dus ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni gzhag ste'o //
translated: Except in an emergency: this is a postponement.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense entailing confession”: as above.

original: de la ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /🔽dge slong ma nor bu len par byed na mig phug pa @340a *//
analyzed: de la ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / dge slong ma nor bu len par byed na mig phug pa @340a *//
translated: What is the offense here?🔽If a bhikṣuṇī takes a gem,

original: len na ltung byed do //
analyzed: len na ltung byed do //
translated: if she takes one with a hole in it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: mig ma phug pa len na nyes byas so //
analyzed: mig ma phug pa len na nyes byas so //
translated: If she takes one without a hole in it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nor bu la ji lta ba de bzhin du mu tig dang / rdo rje dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang / dngul dang / rin po che dang / dmar po dang / dung g-yas su 'khyil ba phug pa len na ltung byed do //
analyzed: nor bu la ji lta ba de bzhin du mu tig dang / rdo rje dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang / dngul dang / rin po che dang / dmar po dang / dung g-yas su 'khyil ba phug pa len na ltung byed do //
translated: As with a gem, so it is with a pearl, a diamond, a lapis lazuli, a conch, a crystal, a coral, silver, gold, a ruby, and a right-coiling shell: if she takes one with a hole in it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: ma phug pa len na nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma phug pa len na nyes byas so //
translated: If she takes one without a hole in it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tha na nor bu mching bu len na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: tha na nor bu mching bu len na yang nyes byas so //
translated: Even if you take a glass bead, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mgul gdub len na ltung byed do //
analyzed: mgul gdub len na ltung byed do //
translated: If you take a necklace, it is a downfall.

original: de bzhin du gdub bu rgyan can dang / dpung rgyan dang / do shal dang / se mo do la sogs pa la yang ltung byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gdub bu rgyan can dang / dpung rgyan dang / do shal dang / se mo do la sogs pa la yang ltung byed do //
translated: Similarly, if you take a bracelet, an armlet, a necklace, a ring, or anything else like that, it is a downfall.

original: tha na nor bu do zan len na yang nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: tha na nor bu do zan len na yang nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: Even if you take a piece of jewelry made of bone, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong mas dngul gyi nor bu len na mngon mtshan can yin na ltung byed do //
analyzed: dge slong mas dngul gyi nor bu len na mngon mtshan can yin na ltung byed do //
translated: If a nun takes a silver ornament, it is a downfall if it is conspicuous.

original: mngon mtshan can ma yin na nyes byas so //
analyzed: mngon mtshan can ma yin na nyes byas so //
translated: If it is not conspicuous, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tha na ko lham bcos bu len na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: tha na ko lham bcos bu len na yang nyes byas so //
translated: Even if you take a pair of fine shoes, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong mas pi wang rgyud dang bcas pa len na ltung byed do //
analyzed: dge slong mas pi wang rgyud dang bcas pa len na ltung byed do //
translated: If a nun takes a lute with strings, it is a downfall.

original: rgyud med pa len na nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyud med pa len na nyes byas so //
translated: If you take one without strings, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de bzhin du ba bhi sa ka dang / pi wang rgyud gcig pa dang / 'khar rnga dang / rnga bo che dang / rdza rnga dang / rnga pa ta ha la sogs pa rgyud dang bcas pa len na ltung byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du ba bhi sa ka dang / pi wang rgyud gcig pa dang / 'khar rnga dang / rnga bo che dang / rdza rnga dang / rnga pa ta ha la sogs pa rgyud dang bcas pa len na ltung byed do //
translated: If he takes a lute, a one-stringed instrument, a flute, a large drum, a clay drum, a paṭaha drum, or the like, together with its strings, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: rgyud med pa len na nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyud med pa len na nyes byas so //
translated: If he takes it without its strings, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tha na rtsva las byas pa'i pi wang rgyud dang bcas pa len na ltung byed do //
analyzed: tha na rtsva las byas pa'i pi wang rgyud dang bcas pa len na ltung byed do //
translated: If he takes even a lute made of grass, together with its strings, he commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If he takes it without its strings, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rgyud med pa len na nyes byas so; ;de bzhin du rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang / 'khor lo dang / mtshon rtse gcig pa dang / ral gri dang / mdung thung dang / mda' bo che dang / mdung dang / mdung phyed lcags las byas pa dang /🔽lcags @340b mda' dang / mda' phyed lcags las byas pa 'phang du rung ba len na ltung byed do //
analyzed: rgyud med pa len na nyes byas so; ;de bzhin du rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang / 'khor lo dang / mtshon rtse gcig pa dang / ral gri dang / mdung thung dang / mda' bo che dang / mdung dang / mdung phyed lcags las byas pa dang / lcags @340b mda' dang / mda' phyed lcags las byas pa 'phang du rung ba len na ltung byed do //
translated: Similarly, if he takes a single-pointed vajra, a discus, a single-pointed weapon, a sword, a spear, a javelin, a lance, or a halberd made of iron,🔽if it is suitable for throwing, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: 'phang du mi rung ba len na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'phang du mi rung ba len na nyes byas so //
translated: If it is not suitable for throwing, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong mas mda' mde'u dang bcas pa len na ltung byed do //
analyzed: dge slong mas mda' mde'u dang bcas pa len na ltung byed do //
translated: If a nun takes up an arrow with a shaft, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: mde'u med pa len na nyes byas so //
analyzed: mde'u med pa len na nyes byas so //
translated: If she takes up an arrow without a shaft, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tha na rtsva'i gzhu len na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: tha na rtsva'i gzhu len na yang nyes byas so //
translated: If she takes up even a bow made of grass, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong mas sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs brnyan ring bsrel dang bcas pa len na ltung byed do //
analyzed: dge slong mas sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs brnyan ring bsrel dang bcas pa len na ltung byed do //
translated: If a nun takes up a Buddha image with relics, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: ring bsrel med pa yin na nyes byas so //
analyzed: ring bsrel med pa yin na nyes byas so //
translated: If she takes up one without relics, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gal te ston pa la mchod pa'i 'du shes kyis len par byed cing /🔽dge tshul ma'am /
analyzed: gal te ston pa la mchod pa'i 'du shes kyis len par byed cing / dge tshul ma'am /
translated: If she takes it up thinking, “I’ll worship the Teacher,”🔽or if she takes it up from the hands of a novice nun

original: rung bar byed pa'i lag tu bzhag pa la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rung bar byed pa'i lag tu bzhag pa la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: or a lay follower who is authorized, there is no offense.🔽The chapter on offenses entailing confession is finished.

original: bar sdom ni /
analyzed: bar sdom ni /
translated: The summary:🔽Gems, necklaces, lutes,🔽spears, bows, arrows,

original: nor bu mgul gdub pi wang dang // mdung dang gzhu dang mda' dag dang // ring bsrel bcas pa'i sku gzugs te //
analyzed: nor bu mgul gdub pi wang dang // mdung dang gzhu dang mda' dag dang // ring bsrel bcas pa'i sku gzugs te //
translated: and images with relics—

original: 'dir ni yang dag bsdus pa yin //
analyzed: 'dir ni yang dag bsdus pa yin //
translated: these are properly summarized.

original: ltung byed lnga pa'i gnyis pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: ltung byed lnga pa'i gnyis pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The second training rule on confession is finished.

original: gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na'o //
translated: The origin of the offense entailing confession for taking what is not given took place in Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po gzugs can snying po la dka' thub kyi chu grang ba na dro bar tshor ba dang / dro ba na bsil bar tshor ba gsum yod pa de /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po gzugs can snying po la dka' thub kyi chu grang ba na dro bar tshor ba dang / dro ba na bsil bar tshor ba gsum yod pa de /
translated: At that time, King Bimbisāra had three kinds of water for his austerities:🔽one that felt warm when cold,

original: gcig tu ni rgyal po rang nyid khrus byed do //🔽gnyis par ni btsun mo'o //
analyzed: gcig tu ni rgyal po rang nyid khrus byed do // gnyis par ni btsun mo'o //
translated: one that felt cool when warm, and

analyzed: gsum par ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi thun mong ngo //
translated: one that was common to all the world.

original: de nas rgyal po gzugs can snying pos bsams pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po gzugs can snying pos bsams pa /
translated: Then King Bimbisāra thought,

analyzed: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la thams cad du yo byad thams cad kyis bkur sti mang du ni byas na dka' thub kyi chu'i khrus kyis ma byas kyi /
translated: “I have served the Blessed One and the saṅgha of hearers with all the requisites in every way, but I have not served them with the water for austerities.

analyzed: ma la bdag gis bcom ldan 'das dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma @341a *//
translated: Now I will offer the Blessed One and the monks and nuns

original: rnams la dka' thub kyi chu gnyis ci bder dbul lo //
analyzed: rnams la dka' thub kyi chu gnyis ci bder dbul lo //
translated: the two waters for austerities as much as they like.”

original: snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Having thought this,

analyzed: rgyal po gzugs can snying po bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste phyin pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /

analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /

translated: As he sat to one side, the Blessed One, through talk consistent with the Dharma, instructed, inspired, . . . the king.

analyzed: stan las langs te / bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas /
translated: He rose from his seat,🔽put his upper robe over one shoulder,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyan thos ma'i dge 'dun dang thabs cig la /

analyzed: bdag dka' thub kyi chab nyid dbul te /

analyzed: rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba khrus bgyid pa gang lags pa der ni bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa khrus mdzad du gsol /

analyzed: gang du mchis brang 'khor dang bcas pa khrus bgyid pa der ni /
translated: “In the bathing pool where the king’s retinue bathes,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos ma'i dge 'dun ci bder khrus bgyi zhing bzhes su gsol /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas rgyal po gzugs can snying po las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas rgyal po gzugs can snying po las 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dka' thub kyi chu'i khrus bzhes par gnang ngo //

analyzed: de nas ji tsam na rgyal po zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: song ngo zhes bya ba'i bar ro //

analyzed: de nas bcu gnyis sde rnams @341b kyis; bcom ldan 'das rgyal po gzugs can snying pos dka' thub kyi chu'i khrus la spyan drangs pa las /
translated: Then the group of twelve heard that the Blessed One had been invited by King Bimbisāra to bathe in the water of the ascetics’ grove

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gnang ngo zhes thos so //

translated: After hearing this, the group of twelve went to the bathing place of King Bimbisāra’s queen to bathe.

analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i btsun mo khrus byed par 'dod nas; de dka' thub kyi chu gang na ba der song ba na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: At that time, King Bimbisāra’s queen, wishing to bathe, went to the bathing place, and so on up to

analyzed: bcu gnyis sde rnams las skabs ma rnyed do zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: “The group of twelve did not get a chance.”

analyzed: de nas dge slong ma rnams kyi mdun du smod par byed pa na /
translated: Then, in front of the nuns, they disparaged the nuns.

original: dge slong ma rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The nuns asked the Blessed One about it, and the Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na khrus mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na khrus mi bya'o //
translated: “Therefore, you should not bathe.”

original: de rnams khrus ma byas pas /
analyzed: de rnams khrus ma byas pas /
translated: Since they did not bathe,

original: lus shin tu dri mi zhim zhing bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: lus shin tu dri mi zhim zhing bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
translated: their bodies became very smelly, and when they went for alms,🔽the householders said,

analyzed: khyim pa mo rnams kyis 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: “Hey, hey!

analyzed: dri ngan pa zhig mnam lags so // dge slong ma drang po drang ba'i rang bzhin can de rnams kyis 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: “I smell a foul odor.”

analyzed: dri ngan pa de ni kho mo cag gi lus kyi yin no //
translated: The honest, straightforward bhikṣuṇīs said, “That foul odor is ours.”

original: de dag gis 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de dag gis 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: They said, “Why is that?”

original: khyed cag gis khrus ma bgyis sam /🔽de dag gis 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: khyed cag gis khrus ma bgyis sam / de dag gis 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis khrus mi bya'o zhes dgag pa mdzad do zhes bya ba'i skabs de /
translated: “The Blessed One has prohibited bathing.”

original: dge slong ma rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽de lta bas @342a *//
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / de lta bas @342a *//
translated: The bhikṣuṇīs told the Blessed One about this, and the Blessed One said,

analyzed: na zla ba phyed phyed cing khrus bya'o //
translated: “Therefore, you should bathe every half-month.

original: de nas tsha bas gdungs nas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tsha bas gdungs nas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Then, when they were tormented by the heat,

analyzed: zla ba phyed dang gsum ni tsha ba'i dus so zhes byas te /
translated: three half-months are the hot season.”

analyzed: khrus bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar ro; ;de bzhin du na ba dus so zhes byin gyis brlabs te khrus bya'o //
translated: In the same way, they consecrated the time, saying, “It’s time to be sick,” and bathed.

original: de bzhin du las dus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du las dus so //
translated: “It’s time to work.”

original: lam dus so //
analyzed: lam dus so //
translated: “It’s time to travel.”

original: rlung dang / char pa dus so //
analyzed: rlung dang / char pa dus so //
translated: “It’s time for wind and rain.”

original: zhes byin gyis brlabs te khrus bya'o //🔽de nas bcu gnyis sde de rnams tsha ba dus so //
analyzed: zhes byin gyis brlabs te khrus bya'o // de nas bcu gnyis sde de rnams tsha ba dus so //
translated: and bathed.🔽Then the nuns of the group of six consecrated the time, saying, “It’s time to be hot,” and bathed all the time.

analyzed: zhes byas nas dus thams cad du khrus byed pa dang / don nyung ba'i dge slong ma dag smod par byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gsol to; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang zhes bya ba nas /
